docs.snippet: BP and Norway's Statoil will withdraw staff from two gas plants in Algeria after an attack by militants on one  of the sites in the North African country, the companies said on Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: BP and Norway's Statoil will withdraw staff from two gas plants in Algeria after an attack by militants on one  of the sites in the North African country, the companies said on Monday.

headline.main: BP, Statoil to Withdraw Staff From Algerian Plants After Attack
headline.print_headline: BP, Statoil to Withdraw Staff From Algerian Plants After Attack

docs.snippet: U.S.-based IHS Inc agreed to buy Markit Ltd to create a $13 billion (£9 billion) London-based data and business research provider, in the latest example of a U.S. company moving its domicile overseas where corporate tax rates are lower.
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S.-based IHS Inc agreed to buy Markit Ltd to create a $13 billion (£9 billion) London-based data and business research provider, in the latest example of a U.S. company moving its domicile overseas where corporate tax rates are lower.

headline.main: IHS to Buy Data Provider Markit, Combined Company to Base in UK
headline.print_headline: IHS to Buy Data Provider Markit, Combined Company to Base in UK

docs.snippet: More than a year after Uber announced a research pact with Carnegie Mellon University - and then hired away four of the institution's faculty and 36 researchers and technicians - the ride-hailing company and university have not collaborated on a...
docs.lead_paragraph: More than a year after Uber announced a research pact with Carnegie Mellon University - and then hired away four of the institution's faculty and 36 researchers and technicians - the ride-hailing company and university have not collaborated on a single project, according to CMU faculty and administrators.

headline.main: After a Year, Carnegie Mellon and Uber Research Initiative Is Stalled
headline.print_headline: After a Year, Carnegie Mellon and Uber Research Initiative Is Stalled

docs.snippet: Wang Jianlin, China's richest man, said FIFA's corruption scandal was an opportunity for big Chinese companies to further the country's lofty footballing ambitions by undertaking sponsorship deals with the global governing body.
docs.lead_paragraph: Wang Jianlin, China's richest man, said FIFA's corruption scandal was an opportunity for big Chinese companies to further the country's lofty footballing ambitions by undertaking sponsorship deals with the global governing body.

headline.main: FIFA Scandal Was China's Chance, Says Top Sponsor
headline.print_headline: FIFA Scandal Was China's Chance, Says Top Sponsor

docs.snippet: Kuwait has expelled 11 Lebanese and three Iraqis suspected of belonging to Hezbollah, a Kuwaiti newspaper reported on Monday, nearly three weeks after the country joined other Gulf Arab states in designating the Lebanese Shi'ite group a terrorist...
docs.lead_paragraph: Kuwait has expelled 11 Lebanese and three Iraqis suspected of belonging to Hezbollah, a Kuwaiti newspaper reported on Monday, nearly three weeks after the country joined other Gulf Arab states in designating the Lebanese Shi'ite group a terrorist organization.

headline.main: Kuwait Expels 14 Accused of Hezbollah Links: Report
headline.print_headline: Kuwait Expels 14 Accused of Hezbollah Links: Report

docs.snippet: Two British ships arrived in eastern Japan on Monday to transport a shipment of plutonium — enough to make dozens of atomic bombs — to the U.S. for storage under a bilateral agreement.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two British ships arrived in eastern Japan on Monday to transport a shipment of plutonium — enough to make dozens of atomic bombs — to the U.S. for storage under a bilateral agreement.

headline.main: 2 British Ships Arrive in Japan to Carry Plutonium to US
headline.print_headline: 2 British Ships Arrive in Japan to Carry Plutonium to US

docs.snippet: General Motors Co (GM) is pressing ahead with its investment plans in China, the world's largest auto market, where it expects car demand to grow 3-5 percent a year on average until 2020, executives at the U.S. car maker said.
docs.lead_paragraph: General Motors Co (GM) is pressing ahead with its investment plans in China, the world's largest auto market, where it expects car demand to grow 3-5 percent a year on average until 2020, executives at the U.S. car maker said.

headline.main: GM Says China Investment Plans on Track Despite Maturing Auto Market
headline.print_headline: GM Says China Investment Plans on Track Despite Maturing Auto Market

docs.snippet: Months after abruptly shuttering Bones in Paris, James Henry has opened a new restaurant and pop-up — and shares his whole roast chicken recipe with T.
docs.lead_paragraph: Months after abruptly shuttering Bones in Paris, James Henry has opened a new restaurant and pop-up — and shares his whole roast chicken recipe with T.
docs.abstract: Australian chef James Henry opens popup restaurant called Belon in Hong Kong.

headline.main: An Australian Chef in Hong Kong, Serving Casual French Fare
headline.print_headline: Food Matters: French Cuisine Pops Up in Hong Kong

docs.snippet: A device first tried in 1982 extended lives but raised ethical questions. While its descendants are used only as temporary “bridges” to transplants, regulators are mulling the possibility of again approving permanent implants.
docs.lead_paragraph: A device first tried in 1982 extended lives but raised ethical questions. While its descendants are used only as temporary “bridges” to transplants, regulators are mulling the possibility of again approving permanent implants.

headline.main: Artificial Hearts Ticking Along Decades After Jarvik-7 Debate
